results.name: Decimal expansion of h *Delta nu_{Cs}/c^2 in units of kg in the 2019 SI system of units.
comment: The seven defining constants of the SI system (May 20 2019) are (see the BIPM link):
In brackets are the units given in s, m, kg, A, K, and cd*sr. The symbol sr stands for steradian (or sterad).
K_{cd} is the luminous efficacy of monochromatic radiation of frequency 540*10^12 Hz, with Hz = 1/s.
The given combination of three constants defines the kg from the Planck constant h after s and m have been expressed in terms of Delta nu_{Cs} and c.
link: BIPM, On the revision of the International System of Units (SI), Nov 13-16 2018.
BIPM, On the revision of the International System of Units (SI), BIPM, Nov 13-16 2018.
Max Planck, Ueber irreversible Strahlungsvorgänge [push the PDF button]. Ann. Physik 1 (1900) 69-122. See paragraph 26. Natürliche Maasseinheiten. pp. 120-122.
Wikipedia, 2019 redefinition of SI base units
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Feb 11 2019
